text: Deutscher Gewerkschaftsbund is a confederation of German trade unions. It was a national trade union center of Germany. The DGB hat 8 German trade unions with more than 7 million people (31.12.2004). It was founded in Munich in 12 October 1949. == Trade unions == * IG BAU - IG Bauen-Agrar-Umwelt (Construction, Agriculture, Environment) 424,808 members = 6.06% * IG BCE - IG Bergbau, Chemie, Energie (Mining, Chemicals, Energy) 770,582 members = 10.99% * GEW - Gewerkschaft Erziehung und Wissenschaft (Education and Science) 254,673 members = 3.63% * IGM - IG Metall (Metalworkers) 2,425,005 members = 34.58% * NGG - Gewerkschaft Nahrung-Genuss-Gaststätten (Food, Beverages and Catering) 225,328 members = 3.21% * GdP - Gewerkschaft der Polizei (Police) 177,910 members = 2.54% * TRANSNET Gewerkschaft (Railway Workers) 270,221 members = 3.85% * ver.di - Vereinte Dienstleistungsgewerkschaft (United Services Union) 2,464,510 members = 35.14% ( DGB in total: 7,013,037 members = 100% // all values: 31 December 2004 ) == Presidents == * 1949–1951: Hans Böckler * 1951–1952: Christian Fette * 1952–1956: Walter Freitag * 1956–1962: Willi Richter * 1962–1969: Ludwig Rosenberg * 1969–1982: Heinz-Oskar Vetter * 1982–1990: Ernst Breit * 1990–1994: Heinz-Werner Meyer * 1994–2002: Dieter Schulte * 2002–today: Michael Sommer == Other websites == * DGB homepage Category:Trade unions in Germany
title: German Trade Union Confederation
